criteria: Understanding of Chronic vs. Acute Conditions
descriptions: Student provides no descriptions of symptoms or descriptions are entirely inaccurate.
Student attempts to describe symptoms but descriptions contain significant inaccuracies or are very vague.
Student describes symptoms with some inaccuracies or lacks detail in multiple areas.
Student accurately describes symptoms for some health problems/illnesses, but may have minor inaccuracies or omissions for others.
Student accurately describes symptoms for most health problems/illnesses, with only minor omissions or slight lack of detail.
Student provides thorough and accurate descriptions of symptoms for all listed health problems/illnesses.
Student does not describe symptoms for any of the listed health problems/illnesses.
Student describes symptoms for only one health problem/illness.
Student describes symptoms for two health problems/illnesses.
Student describes symptoms for three health problems/illnesses.
Student describes symptoms for four health problems/illnesses.
Student describes symptoms for all five health problems/illnesses (asthma, allergies, diabetes, influenza, and one other chronic disease).
Student demonstrates no understanding of the difference between chronic and acute conditions.
Student shows a limited understanding of the difference, with significant confusion between chronic and acute illnesses.
Student shows some understanding but misidentifies chronic illnesses or confuses symptoms with acute conditions.
Student mostly understands the difference but has some difficulty categorizing specific illnesses as chronic or acute.
Student demonstrates a good understanding of the difference, accurately identifying most illnesses as chronic or acute.
Student clearly demonstrates a thorough understanding of the differences between chronic and acute conditions, accurately categorizing illnesses and explaining why.
